title: Analyze and document build caching strategy
description: CRITICAL EFFICIENCY ANALYSIS: Document build caching strategy and trade-offs. FINDINGS: (1) Current: NO feed content caching - store.clear() on every build (line 19 feed-loader.ts), all 231 feeds refetched (~10s), (2) GitHub Actions caches npm only (saves ~25s/build), (3) .astro/data-store.json (7.1MB) exists but not persisted across workflow runs, (4) No HTTP caching headers (ETags/Last-Modified) used, (5) Landscape data fetched fresh every build. DOCUMENT: Current strategy (full refresh prioritizes freshness), why it works (10-15s acceptable for daily builds, 150min/month usage), optimization opportunities (ETags could save 5-7s, Astro cache persistence, incremental builds), trade-offs table (freshness vs speed vs complexity), recommendations for Go port (start simple, measure first, consider ETags if needed). Include: Build time breakdown, GitHub Actions quota analysis, when to optimize.
